subject: Re: how to test session beans
msgSnippet: ... JUnitEE has everything on the serverside. Cactus needs the testcases on both the client and server side. With Cactus you can test also client classes. ...
messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., Kevin Olalde <kolalde@l...> wrote:
> Sorry for a question which I can probably answer myself (rtfm),
> but are both JunitEE and Cactus used by implmenting server-side
> test code?

JUnitEE has everything on the serverside.
Cactus needs the testcases on both the client and server side.
With Cactus you can test also client classes.

> Are either of the tools (or others) appropriate for pure client-
> side test code of server-side objects. The objects I'm
> concerned with are only EJBs, no other Servlets, JSP and the like.

JUnitEE is just good for testing EJB's. The TestCases
are in the J2EE server where you want to make the test.
(Cactus is OK too.)

Kaarle Kaila
